item.title: Some Information on #453
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

I dont use MinimapInt 's
I just use the compass.

public XY toMiniMap() throws InterruptedException {
		AryanTile myPlayer = theReflectionMethods.getLocation();
		int xDiff = x - myPlayer.x;
		int yDiff = y - myPlayer.y;
		XY aPoint = new XY(xDiff * 4, yDiff * 4);
		XY aRotatedPoint = CompassMethods.rotate(aPoint, Math
				.toRadians(theReflectionMethods.getCompass()));
		XY thePointOnVirtualMiniMap = new XY(MiniMap.centerX + aRotatedPoint.x,
				MiniMap.centerY - aRotatedPoint.y);
		if (MiniMap.inMiniMap(thePointOnVirtualMiniMap)) {
			return thePointOnVirtualMiniMap;
		}
		return null;
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Some Information on #453
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

regecks`:

Not really, you just grab the exact code for the walking flag positioning, and you have “exact”.

[quote=“jagex”] public Point worldToMinimap(int x, int y) {
x -= getBaseX();
y -= getBaseY();
int calculateX = (x * 4 + 2) - getMyPlayerX() / 32;
int calculateY = (y * 4 + 2) - getMyPlayerY() / 32;
int minimapCalculation = getMinimapInt1() + getMinimapInt2()
& 0x7ff;
int total = calculateY * calculateY + calculateX * calculateX;
if (total > 6400)
return null;
int curvesin = CURVESIN[minimapCalculation];
int curvecos = CURVECOS[minimapCalculation];

        curvesin = (curvesin * 256) / (getMinimapInt3() + 256);
        curvecos = (curvecos * 256) / (getMinimapInt3() + 256);
        int curveCalc1 = calculateY * curvesin + calculateX * curvecos >> 16;
        int curveCalc2 = calculateY * curvecos - calculateX * curvesin >> 16;
        int screenx = 550 + ((94 + curveCalc1) + 4);
        int screeny = 4 + (83 - curveCalc2 - 4);
        return new Point(screenx, screeny);
	}[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Some Information on #453
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Pure color walking:
http://www.rscheata.net/tp/index.php/topic,2703.0.html

I also have a color based CanReach
http://www.rscheata.net/tp/index.php/topic,2318.0.html
I can also implement my advance iARGA methods on top of that.

 public void doPath(Tile[] path) throws InterruptedException {
        int loops = 0;
        Tile end = path[path.length - 1];
        while (distanceTo(end) > 1 && loops < 100) {
            Tile next = findTileAlongInvalidPath(path);
            if (next == null)
                return;
            XY screen = TileToMinimap(next);
            if (screen != null) {
                mouseClickLeft(screen);
                sleep(walkTime(next));
            }
            loops++;
        }
    }
public final Tile findTileAlongInvalidPath(Tile[] path) {
        int MostNear = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < path.length; i++) {
            if (distanceTo(path[i]) < distanceTo(path[MostNear])) {
                MostNear = i;
            }
        }
        int SecMostNear = MostNear;
        if (SecMostNear < path.length - 1) {
            SecMostNear++;
        }
        while (SecMostNear < path.length - 1
                && distanceTo(path[SecMostNear + 1]) < 11) {
            SecMostNear++;
        }
        if (distanceTo(path[SecMostNear]) < 11) {
            return path[SecMostNear];
        } else {
            Tile challenger1 = path[MostNear];
            Tile challenger2 = path[SecMostNear];
            Tile winner = challenger1;
            int winnerDist = distanceTo(winner);
            int distanceBetweenChall = distance(challenger1, challenger2);
            int StartX = challenger1.x;
            int StartY = challenger1.y;
            int dx = StartX - challenger2.x;
            int dy = StartY - challenger2.y;
            for (int i = 0; i <= distanceBetweenChall; i++) {
                Tile Challenger = new Tile(StartX + dx
                        * (i / distanceBetweenChall), StartY + dy
                        * (i / distanceBetweenChall));
                int challengerDist = distanceTo(Challenger);
                if (challengerDist < winnerDist) {
                    winnerDist = challengerDist;
                    winner = Challenger;
                }
            }
            return findTileOnWayToTile(winner);
        }
    }
/**
     * Finds a tile in the direction of the Destionation
     * 
     * @param Destination
     *            The tile to walk to
     * @return Tile in the direction of the Destination, otherwise null.
     */
    public final Tile findTileOnWayToTile(Tile Destination) {
        if (Destination == null)
            return null;
        Tile next = null;
        int x_difference = Destination.x - getTile(getPlayer()).x;
        int y_difference = Destination.y - getTile(getPlayer()).y;
        int abs_x_difference = Math.abs(x_difference);
        int abs_y_difference = Math.abs(y_difference);
        int multiple;
        int x;
        int y;
        int x_change = 0;
        int y_change = 0;
        int size = 0;
        if (distanceTo(Destination) > 9 || !(canReach(Destination))) {
            multiple = 7;
            x = (getTile(getPlayer()).x + multiple * x_difference
                    / (abs_x_difference + abs_y_difference));
            y = (getTile(getPlayer()).y + multiple * y_difference
                    / (abs_x_difference + abs_y_difference));
            while (!(canReach(new Tile(x, y)))) {
                if (size >= 8)
                    break;
                else if (y_change == size && x_change < size && x_change > 0)
                    x_change++;
                else if (x_change == 0 && y_change >= 0) {
                    y_change++;
                    x_change++;
                    size++;
                } else if (y_change == size && x_change < 0)
                    x_change++;
                else if (y_change == (-1 * size) && x_change > (-1 * size))
                    x_change--;
                else if (x_change == size)
                    y_change--;
                else if (x_change == -1 * size)
                    y_change++;
            }
            if (size < 8) {
                next = new Tile(x + x_change, y + y_change);
            }
        } else {
            next = Destination;
        }
        return next;
    }

I believe i can combine the CanReach, (pplsuqbawlz) PlayerPosition, my advance iARGA methods to walk paths Crudly.

Paths would be made up of just a few tiles, bascially whenever the path changes direction a tile will be needed.

I wonder if their is a unform relationship between the playerposition and the pixle location revelent to the world map.

I would like to be able to basically move scripts between the systems with no depencies. Example just override the menthod getMenu to return one made thru reflection, but if that fails return the color based one.

So bascailly the idea is universal scripts that can drop down to using color methods on the event that the reflection based methods break/fail.

Read full topic
